judgment_text:
mnm IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY ORDINARY ORIGINAL CIVIL JURISDICTION LUNATIC PETITION NO. 7 OF 1988 Keshav Ramrao Nadkarni ...Lunatic Mangesh Ramrao Nadkarni ...Petitioner Mr. Satish Kamat, Advocate for Petitioner CORAM : MRS. ROSHAN DALVI, J.

DATED : 9TH MARCH, 2012 P.C. : . The petitioner who is the brother of the person of unsound mind (called lunatic) who is 82 years of age has incurred certain hospitalisation and medical expenses in October 2010 for such person. The hospital bill is to the extent of Rs.13,000/ and the medical bills to the extent of Rs.8000/ . The petitioner shall have to be reimbursed that amount in terms of Judges Order signed today. . A person of unsound mind has no separate income. He is not capable of contracting. Hence he has no PAN card. The office shall consider the case upon the petitioner s PAN card. (ROSHAN DALVI, J.)
reasoning: All fallbacks failed or not confident.
